Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: Include a drawing of a fish in its natural water environment, like a lake or ocean, and identify it as such with a label.
Label key components in the drawing, such as water and plants or algae, but may occasionally miss labeling an item like 'rocks.'
Illustrate and label at least one thing the fish needs to survive, such as water or plants for safety purposes.
Label other living things that might share the habitat, such as another type of fish or underwater plants.
Show the relationship between the fish and its environment, illustrating how the fish needs water to swim and live.
CANNOT: Might inconsistently label smaller or less conspicuous parts of the habitat, such as very tiny aquatic plants or microorganisms, leaving some details unlabeled or incorrectly labeled.
May sometimes omit detailing the specific way the fish interacts with certain elements, like how it might use rocks for protection or camouflaging.
